definition: extreme joy turns to sorrow (idiom); Don't celebrate too soon, things could still go wrong!
music
happy/cheerful/to laugh
surname Yue
surname Le
extremely/pole (geography, physics)/utmost/top
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
sad/sadness/sorrow/grief

sentences.english: Am I Am I retarded or am I just overjoyed?
sentences.chinese: 我是智力迟钝，还是乐极生悲呢？

sentences.english: Try new things and avoid getting too addict to your computer.
sentences.chinese: 尝试新事物，避免乐极生悲吸毒者到您的计算机。

sentences.english: I have a sense something bad will happen.
sentences.chinese: 我有一种乐极生悲的感觉。

sentences.english: We seek happiness, but too much of it leads to sorrow.
sentences.chinese: 快乐，是人之所求，但太乐则乐极生悲。

definition: so pleased as to lose one's sense of measure/beside oneself with joy
the old man lost his mare, but it all turned out for the best (idiom); fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
pinyin: sai4 weng1 shi1 ma3 yan1 zhi1 fei1 fu2

definition: a clever person may become the victim of his own ingenuity (idiom); cleverness may overreach itself/too smart for one's own good
pinyin: cong1 ming2 fan3 bei4 cong1 ming2 wu4

definition: lit. to try to steal a chicken only to end up losing the rice used to lure it (idiom)/fig. to try to gain an advantage only to end up worse off/to go for wool and come back shorn
pinyin: tou1 ji1 bu4 cheng2 shi2 ba3 mi3

definition: lit. the old man lost his horse, but it all turned out for the best (idiom)/fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
misfortune does not come singly (idiom)/it never rains but it pours
to meet with unexpected failure (idiom)/to fail miserably (where failure was not expected)
when things reach an extreme, they can only move in the opposite direction (idiom)
extreme sorrow turns to joy (idiom)
to just escape from calamity
a single slip may cause everlasting sorrow (idiom)
pinyin: yi1 shi1 zu2 cheng2 qian1 gu3 hen4

definition: sudden and unexpected disaster (idiom)
one is bound for good fortune after surviving a great disaster (proverb)
pinyin: da4 nan4 bu4 si3 , bi4 you3 hou4 fu2

definition: lit. an arrogant army is bound to lose (idiom)/fig. pride goes before a fall
if you live a life of crime, sooner or later you'll pay for it
pinyin: chu1 lai2 hun4 chi2 zao3 yao4 huan2 de5

definition: serves you right for doing sth so stupid (Internet slang)
pinyin: bu4 zuo4 si3 jiu4 bu4 hui4 si3
